I have deleted all the unnecessary comments regarding "sugar".We are all adults here  no need to resort to name-calling just because someone's financial lifestyle does not match yours.Also  we are a gender diverse group  so do not past such sexist remarks which makes other people feel uncomfortable or even insulted.I entrust my admins to moderate the chat on my behalf. Repeat of such behavior will be outright ban.

Money/credit is just a means to an end. So you scrimp and save for 50 years till retirement  you also do a thorough needs analysis whenever you are required to spend 10 cents over budget. You are going to lead a miserable life and your partner (if you can find one) would probably distance themselves from you. My father is one such person and I can tell you his wife is miserable every day.

Just use your money to buy things you value. And no one can tell you what value is. Some people value experiences (vacation) some value electronic gadgets  some value being pampered (hair salon  spas  etc). And some people just like seeing their money grow so they buy financial products. But there is no wrong way to spend your money. You do you  don‚Äôt let others tell you otherwise! üëç
